Package com.bytefacets.collections.arrays

Class GenericArray

java.lang.Object
com.bytefacets.collections.arrays.GenericArray
public final class GenericArray extends Object
Utility class for Generic

    Creates a new array, copies the contents of the given array into the new one, and fills the remainder with the default value.

    If the entry/index is not within the bounds of the given array, a copy is created with a new size that can accommodate the entry, and the new indexes are filled with the default value.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static <T> T[] create(int size)
      Creates a new Object[] of the given size, but cast to T[].

    • create

      public static <T> T[] create(Class<T> type, int size)
      Creates a typed array of the given size using Array.newInstance.

    • create

      public static <T> T[] create(int size, T defaultValue)
      Creates a new Object[] array of the given size, and if the default value is not null, fills the array with the value.

    • resize

      public static <T> T[] resize(T[] array, int newSize)
      Resizes the given array to the new size. There are no bounds checks.

    • fill

      public static <T> void fill(T[] array, T value, int fromOffset, int length)
      Fills the section of the array with the given value. There are no bounds checks.

    • fill

      public static <T> void fill(T[] array, T value)
      Fills the array with the given value.

    • copyOf

      public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] source, int newLength, T defaultValue)
      Creates a new array, copies the contents of the given array into the new one, and fills the remainder with the default value.

    • copyOf

      public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] source, int newLength)
      Creates a copy of the array using Arrays.copyOf.

    • ensureSize

      public static <T> T[] ensureSize(T[] array, int size)
      If the size is larger than the given array, a copy is created with a new size that can accommodate the size. The growth formula is a doubling growth. If the original array is 0-length, the array is grown as if it were size 1.

    • ensureSize

      public static <T> T[] ensureSize(T[] array, int size, T initialValue)
      If the size is larger than the given array, a copy is created with a new size that can accommodate the size, and the new indexes are filled with the default value. The growth formula is a doubling growth. If the original array is 0-length, the array is grown as if it were size 1.

    • ensureEntry

      public static <T> T[] ensureEntry(T[] array, int entry)
      If the entry/index is not within the bounds of the given array, a copy is created with a new size that can accommodate the entry. The growth formula is a doubling growth. If the original array is 0-length, the array is grown as if it were size 1.

    • ensureEntry

      public static <T> T[] ensureEntry(T[] array, int entry, T initialValue)
      If the entry/index is not within the bounds of the given array, a copy is created with a new size that can accommodate the entry, and the new indexes are filled with the default value. The growth formula is a doubling growth. If the original array is 0-length, the array is grown as if it were size 1.
